Author: Justin Gunther
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: Tile seemed to work much better with my old iPhone. Now it seems to have connection issues, it will say it is ringing the tile when it isn't, and it doesn't really work with Alexa anymore because they don't stay connected to my phone. My phone is a Galaxy Note 8. I would not recommend these for an android user.

Author: The Angry_Tank
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: Great idea but wth, I can't trigger the sound on the tile. There's nothing on the screen to press so it will sound off. The tile goes off but at random like maybe every 20min average on its own. I have no control over it. The tile itself is supposed to be able to call my phone by pressing twice on the time itself, nothing. Not one Goddamn call to my phone. The tile just plays its little tune without connecting via signal to my phone. The only thing working is the map but what good is that if I can't trigger the tag?

Author: A Google user
Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Text: In short, it works ok and I would buy again. No where near perfect but a great tool. It does eat up my battery so I have to turn off my bluetooth. Kinda defeats one of the purposes of the app and that's to keep track of where it was last seen by your bluetooth.

Author: Joey Crawford
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: The app doesn't connect frequently enough to my tiles to be of any use. It isn't really helpful to know where my tiles were two days ago. I need to know where they were when last in proximity to my phone. Completely useless.

Author: Jancarlo Gutierrez
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: Seriously disappointed... as soon as I close the app, as I usually do with all apps in the background to conserve battery, the tile become useless and even if I'm pressing it literally next to my phone. "Locate tiles when app is closed" is absolutely useless and the most crucial part for buying these tiles. I might return this if it doesn't get fixed. I love the idea, but this feature seriously needs to get fixed.

Author: A Google user
Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Text: It's a good concept. I wish the bluetooth would update quicker. If you make a quick pit stop like a gas station and leave your wallet behind before the app can update your tile location, it could be a problem. I would buy it again for the peace of mind though.

Author: Cenon Manansala
Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Text: The best tracker I have ever owned. I've tried other brands, but nothing comes close to how Tile performs! I cannot live without it, I'm notorious for losing my keys every now and then.

Author: Nanci Freeman
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: Sporadic. I do not recommend. I have a tile in my right hand. I am ringing the tile from my phone. The display saus the tile is within range and that I should walk around until it beats. The tile never beeped. This is a frequent occurrence. A tile will be nearby and I received a message that I will be notified when it is found. This would be for my keys, my planner, things that are in the vicinity but the phone never rings the app. Then I get a stupid email saying that the tile has been found. This does not help me at all. I am looking for the items to lay my hands on them immediately. That's why I bought the tile. The tile works incrementally at best. It's just slightly better than nothing.

Author: Daniel C
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: App gets killed in the background after a while, so my tiles aren't constantly tracked. I have turned on the option "track tiles when app is closed".

Author: Kristen Olgren
Stars: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
Text: The Tile app/finder is the best of these things out there. I've tried several. That said, I really can't afford to replace them all every year. I wish they would offer this with replaceable batteries. The app also routinely closes itself on my phone. I'd like it to continue to work, even if the app is closed.

Author: marc nunkesser
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: (Final update): Works only 50% of the time with my Pixel 2. Slim Tiles keep breaking. (Updated again) While I love tiles when they work they haven't been working well for me recently. This may be related to my update to Android O. For the last weeks, even if I place the tile directly next to my phone it has trouble connecting. (Updated) My Tile Slim in my wallet stopped working after one month, staying silent on key presses and no longer connecting to the phone. Customer service tried to help me fix the problem and after some back and forth did replace the Tile.

Author: David Cooper
Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Text: Edited review: More reliable thanks to last app update. Stars added. _(For several weeks I've tested my 2 tiles. Hit or miss if the app sees even one of them. Yes, GPS and BT on phone are on 24/7. Paired easy enough. Today I 'hid' one of the paired tiles less than 10 feet away and 30 min later it was still no joy. In frustration I went & stood right over it and it finally found it after a while. If you lose your keys, etc. they may eventually be found if a passerby with the app running stands over it for a while.)

Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

It shows where they are on the map, though I have not tested the range for that, but you can change the tune it plays when you need to find it. I just wish it didn't disconnect because then they can't find your phone.

Author: brian spaid
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: I received my tile it worked for two days and now it just no longer works. I didn't mistreat it almost just sat on a counter top. Work great right out of the box an it won't ring almost like it has no power or it is dead. Not happy with this product.

Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars

Author: Chuck Downs
Stars: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
Text: Once you get the tiles to activate they work great. The problem is getting the Tiles to activate. Installation & replacing Tiles is difficult because lack of document instruction with in the app. Says "easy app instructions". They have changed the name of your replaced tile with "(replaced) and then don't hide them, so it is confusing when the replacement tile doesn't show up until you close and reopen the app. With better documentation and replacement app functionality this would be 5 star app.

Author: Winter Smith
Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Text: The sound isn't very loud. Will not connect to bluetooth on my Note 8. Would really love it to have an alarm, that if the device is disconnected it will send an alarm. This is day one of using the device, might have to send an update later.

Author: Melissa Grohman
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: I so wanted this to be the answer to my disorganization, but it just gives me a false sense of security. I've never once found my keys with this thing. Tonight it claimed to have found them, and I spent 20 minutes turning off everything in the house listening for the alarm. Finally found them in the couch, 3 feet from where I started my search, not making a sound. This was a waste of money.

Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

Don't waste your time, look elsewhere and please let me know if you find something better. P.S. Their customer service is on par with AT&T

The app is very useful, however the hardware needs some work.

Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars

Not worth the cash or headache.

Author: Brody Roberts
Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Text: This is soooooo great!!! I've honestly needed this for so long and am glad I got to use it, I always lose things and this has made that issue very simple. I even was able to ring my wallet at a party and found it ringing in someone's pocket and was able to retrieve before they left and got away with it!! So I just wanted to leave an awesome comment (which I never do) because this has honestly been one of the best things I have spent my money on and I hope anyone interested in it reads this and knows that's if you have problems with losing things like me that this is the exact thing for you!

Author: Rich Muller
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: Revised review, the app has greatly improved since my last review. It has greatly improved on both usability and connectivity. Despite the improved app I will not be replacing any of them this coming year. I'll be looking for a different brand. One died, can not just replace battery so I should buy a new one for the cost of a 50 cent battery? I don't think so.... Revised again: update to their software today. Out of 4 tiles, the tile app only finds one. All 4 are only 8 feet away sitting next to each other. No doubt I'm switching brands now. Devices that don't connect are worthless. 11 months and 4 say they need replacing, the 5th is dead. $100 to replace them? I don't think so. I can find the tiles about 50% of the time if I fool around turning on/off Bluetooth, going in and out of the app, and waving my phone over the tile while saying a prayer. Junk, that's it going in the trash so I can't waste my time trying to make them work.

Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Text: This product is a great idea and works. But I have an issue... when the battery died I found out you can't replace just the battery. They want you to buy a new tile. That's insane. No way will I do that. And if you read the reviews I'm obviously not the only one complaining about the battery issue. Your customers read your reviews... maybe you should too. So let me tell everybody just because they say you can't replace the battery doesn't mean you can't replace the battery. If you take a small sherp object and go around the groove you can remove the glue and separate the two pieces. Then you can replace the 3 volt battery inside. Like I did. Thank you customer service for not help we will help ourselves.

Author: Steven Tessler
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: Does not ring misplaced phone in home. Only way to get a tile to ring phone is to first find phone, then open tile app. Then and only then does phone ring when pressing a tile button. Same goes for finding a tile from phone. Must first find your keys. Then turn off Bluetooth. Turn Bluetooth Back on. Then tile app on phone may ring tile. Rinse repeat. five times over the past two months trying to locate either my car keys or my phone when trying to find them on my way to work, all my tile mates fail to ring my phone and phone fails to ring tile mate. tile customer service responds with typical nonsense. i.e. 1) make sure you have our latest app version yesterday's version is the cause, you must have today's version. 2) just have a configuration error please uninstall and reinstall our app . 3) your phone must be in power save mode please make sure that you are not in power save mode 4) something else must be wrong with your phone so please power off your phone and reboot your phone . 5) your Bluetooth stack must be out of whack . Please turn off your Bluetooth and then turn your Bluetooth back on. of course tile company has many excuses for the complete failure of their device to help you find either your keys or your phone when you're late for work and want to leave your house. none of their "suggestions" are in the least bit helpful for a device that is supposed to be a utility to make your life easier in locating your miss placed keys or your misplaced phone . Tile is a complete waste of money total failure of a product sold in the guise of helping you uncomplicate your life by finding misplaced keys phone wallet. save yourself the aggravation and waste of money . don't buy this product.

Another feature of like to see is maybe customisable ring tones and a customisable ring tone for the phoenix as well. Other than that it's an excellent product and an excellent app and would totally reccomend to anyone who finds themselves losing their keys often.

Author: Clint Turner
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: What a wonderful concept! I only wish it worked with my Google pixel. The app can never detect it even when my Bluetooth is on and I have the keys literally sitting on my phone. I've waited for 20 minutes with the app saying "connecting" with no sign of life.

Author: JA T
Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Text: EDIT: Confirmed, using high accuracy location services from morning at full battery gets me to 20% by evening. Normally evening at 80%. Not confident to give some Tiles to misses for Xmas, so wasted money. When using high power mode, Tile app still only pinpoints to 100m radius (which is good enough) because no GPS lock ever possible in home and shops, so really do need app to work with power saving location (cell, WiFi). Please sort this otherwise I've wasted money!

Author: Jonas Svedas
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: Other than for finding things like keys in your house it's useless. Update: the problem is not that it does not perform as intended is rather that for someone like me who does not lose things in their house because they know were things are it serves no purpose. The fundamental problem is that this relies on Bluetooth thus your item you search for will be within 30 meters. So if you really loose something (not in your house) you wont find it. What I am interested in is tracking stuff like a backpack (in case some one steels it, or gets lost at the airport). For this would be nice to have a rechargeable tile with GSM or GPS connectivity to the phone or something like that.

Author: Lisa Bee
Stars: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
Text: I like the concept of this device and app. But so far I've had one tile device that had an intermittent ringer. I replaced it with another one in so far so good. I also wish that there was more explanation about how I'm at work actually worked so that I understood why sometimes it took a while for its location update.

Author: Debbie Daniels
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: Totally don't get it. I followed instructions step by step (2 tiles and one mate). One tile beeps randomly. I've misplaced my phone twice. I tried pushing the logo on another tile and that one beeps and I still can't locate my phone except the old fashioned way - look for it. I've tried to locate my keys (the mate is on them). Again, only the tile I have that I've pushed the logo beeps. Nearly useless. I say useless because sometimes it's fun to push the tile WHILE I have my phone just to hear it beep. Sorry I spent money on them. I still bug my family to call my phone so I can find it.

Author: A Google user
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: I have the newest phone around (Pixel 2) and the latest version of the Tile app, and I've only had the device itself for about 3 months. It never really connected very reliably from the start, and now it almost never connects, even up close. The Motorola version of this was one of the worst products I've ever bought. I had high hopes for Tile cuz I really need this functionality. But Tile is barely better than the Motorola version. And not only that, you can't replace the battery so it's junk after 1 year. That wouldn't be a deal breaker if the thing actually worked really well. But it absolutely doesn't. Super disappointing.

Author: jjporno
Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Text: has saved me from having to replace my things multiple times. my only wish is that the thin tiles were a little louder as it's a little difficult to hear from inside my wallet. otherwise an awesome product and the app is very easy to use.

Author: Michael Walker
Stars: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
Text: Overall satisfied. The app works well enough, although it is difficult to find the commands to transfer the ownership of a tile to someone else. things I would like to see improve are make the alarm louder on the tile, which is good on my keys and such, but the one I keep in my wallet is very muffled by the leather and the room needs to be quiet to hear it. Bluetooth range on them could be better, but it tends to work as long as you are in the same room.

Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars

Author: Deanna Craig
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: (Original, 2016) I have a tile on my keys, my boyfriend's keys, & my cat's collar (she uses the dog door to go out and roam the neighborhood). The app works great for the keys, not so much for the cat. I put it on her to keep track of where she was and to make sure she was in the house before locking up at night. But I found out it doesn't track the perimeter of our house or garage, much less the front or back yard. It's great if I lose my keys in the central part of the house. It's also nice to ring my phone from the title. Update (Jan 2018): due to recent patches the tile ringer volume is practically nonexistent. I have tried technical support suggestions but the tiles are only good for viewing an approximate area on my phone screen. No longer working as intended and I'll be updating my star rating.

Author: Logan Prater
Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Text: Has saved me many times over. I lost my keys at Bonnaroo (music festival for those who don't know) and despite the lost and found team hunting and the clean vibes team hunting I never saw them again and I had to buy a new key fob for my car. Being a procrastinator I am always running out the door last second. Now instead of spending an extra unplanned 10 minutes hunting for my keys and being late for work I just reach for my phone and turn on the Bluetooth and ring my keys. (Despite what I've read you don't have to keep your Bluetooth on all the time and drain your battery. I keep my Bluetooth off until I need to find them and have no issues doing it this way.. but then again I'm never hunting for them further than 100ft maybe). Sometimes they fell behind my bed or maybe they're right in front of me laying on the kitchen table, either way I have them in less than 60 seconds. It's helped me so much I just decided to buy the 4 pack combo with 2 slims and 2 mates. I'm always losing my wallet; falling out of my pocket, leaving it in my car between the seats, laying it down at a friend's house, etc so I got the slim for that and since the 4 pack is just $30 more than a slim by itself it made since to get the 4 pack. Now I have one for my car so I can find it in huge parking lots, from Walmart to amusement parks.. this saves time, and then 2 others I can still find a purpose for. It's truly a great product with a great service and worth every penny I've spent on them.

Author: Roy Strattman
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: Both the device and the app turned out to be absolute garbage. My girlfriend and I both installed it on our phones and put the tile on our cat's collar. We set it up according to the instructions and it rang and all that. Once we got it activated, neither of us were able to make it ring from the apps on our phones. Support shows a screenshot of a page on the app where there's a green button you can press to make it ring. Neither my girlfriend nor I could find that page in the app and we tried everything. Also, our phones only pick up the device some of the time and we're sitting right next to it. My girlfriend's app doesn't show the device at all anymore. And there's no phone number for tech support. Completely worthless and we are returning it and never again

Author: A Google user
Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Text: My mate bought me the tile sport for Christmas as I'm always losing everything. I am well impressed with it, so much so I bought a pack of 4 which included 2 key and 2 wallet tiles. I have saved hours of time with the help of this product already this year!!! There are areas for improvement though which is why I've gave a 4 star rating. First of all the battery issue....I personally think it's wrong you buy a product that will be no good after 12 months especially with how much they are to buy in the first place. It either needs a charging port or adapted to charge through a wireless charger. Failing that a battery that lasts longer. Or heavily discount the replacement fee after the 12 month period. Sometimes the Bluetooth struggles to find Item if you're just outside the house but item is in the 100ft range. I'm guessing but I reckon most people loose keys and wallets in there own homes so would there be a way to locate your tile through WiFi rather than Bluetooth which is more prone to interference from solid objects? It would also be handy if it was a bit louder than it is, especially the wallet version as it's in an enclosed space. Maybe changing speaker location if to much drain on battery! This product is the key to lost items (pardon the pun) and has great potential it's just not quite there yet.

Author: Michael Witt
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: Oh my god, spam, spam spam spam spam, Lowest price ever, last day today, no now it's lowest price, and it's been going on for months. Marketing is so incredibly aggressive. Every day they ask me if I want to buy more tiles. I mean could you imagine if every product you ever bought bought you every day to buy more? Can't find a way to stop them, I'm looking for alternative tracking products so I can switch and block them. On the up side, the product is finally working pretty well, dead tiles alert you before they die and they seem to last almost the advertised length. I worry that the marketing is so aggressive because they company isn't in the black and i'll end up with $200 in tracking tiles that can't be used or get my information sold off, starving companies make poor life decisions.

Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: E-Waste of money...so you forget where you left your keys? But you can't quickly replace the battery, infact you CANNOT CHANGE THE BATTERY at all, as it is a sealed unit the only place for it after a year is the bin, electronic waste (E-Waste) is not exceptable in this age, it's actually quite disgusting that something would be made in the knowledge IT WILL END UP IN THE BIN. The concept is very good, and for the short while it works it works reasonably well, but it should come with pin draw or a coin screw opening so that you can change the battery, it would be better if the device cost more to purchase with the ability to replace the battery. I will not be replacing my Tile before this change has been made.

It's definitely given me more piece of mind since moving to a bigger city.

Author: Patrick Leaper
Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Text: This is a God send for people like me. I've recovered my keys, glasses case, luggage and phone so many times it's hard to admit. But knowing I can find where things relieves so much stress and hassle. I can't imagine ever being without them. I use 8 Tiles to keep me sane.

Author: Jo Warren
Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Text: *Update* - after contacting support about the location not updating, they said that it seems the battery drained prematurely or there's a hardware problem. Since it's still under warranty, they're going to send me a replacement tile. That doesn't help me find my keys, but good customer service. Added 1 star for that, but I stand by my original review that Bluetooth is unreliable for tracking. *Original* - The concept is good, but the execution is lacking. For one, most people don't just walk around with their Bluetooth on. So if you lose your phone, the function to ring it with the the tile is essentially useless. Updating the tile location also seems inconsistent and unreliable. I lost my keys while out of the house last weekend. My tile location hasn't been updated since July 19 (4 months), but I know for a fact I have been around the tile with my Bluetooth on more recently than 4 months ago, and supposedly other people with the Tile app nearby should also update the location. If they could figure out a more reliable way to track than with Bluetooth, it would be a great app. It's also quite expensive for what you get IMO.

Author: A Google user
Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Text: Guest chairs at the office are in short supply, and they are all identical. My guest chair was "borrowed" and no one would fess up to taking it. Thanks to the Tile I'd attached to the bottom of the seat, I was able to recover my chair. Good times.

Author: Cynthia Morgan
Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Text: I was always loosing my keys and would have my family helping me to find them so last Christmas my son gave me tile as a gift one of the best things anyone could ever get me scene I've had it I now can find my keys at any given time I once was shopping and did not notice I had left my wallet at the check out the next day I realized I did not have it I rembered that I had a tile in my wallet I checked my tile app on my phone and it showed me the area where it was which was the store I was at the other day I called the store and they had it THANKS to my son and the Tile company.

Author: Kevin Larsen
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: What a big disappointment! The idea is fantastic; the execution terrible. It has trouble finding tiles that are right nearby. I have the app installed on two of my phones: an Android and an iPhone. The iPhone can find the Android, but the Android can't find the iPhone. And they take forever to find my keys. Don't bother trying to change the ringtone. It will sit there at 0% all day and not move. You'll end up having to log off and back on to use that tile again. The thing is also a battery suck. For something that works very unreliably. Now for the fun part. Watch me get a very generic reply, expressing disappointment that I'm having trouble with the app, and you email them, and blah, blah, blah. You'd think with the numerous complaints that by now they'd have a few standard fixes to offer. Or updated their app to fix all these bugs. If you haven't bought this thing, hold off. If you already have, join the line of customers needing help.

Author: gary barrell
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: I have to say I think more effort and time has gone into the iPhone version.. This is very disappointing. I dropped my tile on purpose over park and walked away 300 meters or so.. And then tried to track it back.. You have to flick between map and the tile to see if you are reconnected.. And even though I got within 15 metres of the tile it said connecting but it wasn't till I was on top of it it then allowed me to activate the ring.. If I hadn't known where it was I prob would have kissed it.. Won't be buying another. Sorry much more work to do on this.. U should be able to find it on one screen without flicking and a notification should ring if you have list contact with it straight away... Nice concept poor in design.. Also my phone doesn't ring when pressing the tile button.. Sony xa1 ultra...

Author: Jon Takacs
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: Buggy Find your phone only seems to work if you launch tile at least once after booting, which is dangerous. Today, I tried to use it to find my wallet only to have the app claim it was last seen 3 hours ago. I had just used the wallet at a store, earlier than that. The last seen was around my house - I found the wallet/tile and it did not respond at all tp the app, even when marked as"lost" and even when the button on the tile was pressed twice. Worked fine AFTER reseting my phone... :( Wondering if this product is useful to me or bot. So far, its making life more complicated - and isn't "there" when I need it. Engineerings my day job, really sucks to have to debug everything I want to "Just Work"

Author: Marlene Baquiran
Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Text: I have a chronic case of absent mindedness to the extent that it borderline harms the ones I hold most dear to me and I am considering physically giving myself brain damage so that I have a legitimate excuse to relinquish responsibility for holding and placing literally any physical object due to being more forgetful than my dog who gets excited about going on a walk while he's on a walk. My dumbass assin tired-ass ass apparently thought it would be a fantastic idea to wedge my wallet (containing my passport and a freshly acquired visa) in between a keyboard and an old PC behind a full tray of tuna cans last night. My dumbass assin ass paid no regard to the fact that my future dumbass self had an international flight the next day for a uni project I was fortunate enough to be funded for because some poor soul put enough trust in me to be responsible for something. If I missed this flight - and had to take the time replace my wallet and passport/visa - I would have inflicted a betrayal worse than Judas himself on my peers and even moreso, myself. Cue the morning following the offense: 1. Silently panic. 2. Visibly and audibly panic. 3. Fervent upturning of my entire room and the living room. Note I had just moved back home the night before so this involved rummaging through a dozen bags, none of which had any clear logic or sense of categorization in their contents. Also included: intermittent assumption of the foetal position on the floor. No dice. 4. Lightly consider using the Tile app, which I had bitterly uninstalled months prior to clear up space and because I felt it hadn't paid itself back at all. But it probably wouldn't help because my dumba-- thought I must have lost it on the street in the bountiful boroughs of western Sydney. Knowing my dumba-- self, this is generally the most likely scenario and in less dire situations I would have already surrendered to this fate. 5. Rummage hopelessly some more, consider calling the Lebanese garlic chicken restaurant I was at last night (they weren't open at 9am.) 6. Reinstall Tile. What the hell! It still works. What the double hell!! My wallet is nearby. Never have I felt both so cursed and blessed by the gods at once. I excavated my wallet from the mass of tuna cans and discarded computer peripherals as Martha and Mary did roll away the stone from Lazarus' tomb, and that fine MIDI jingle that emanated from my wallet proclaimed to me: "I am the resurrection, and the life: he that believeth in me, though he were dead, yet shall he live: And whoever liver and believeth in me shall never die". Overall, 5/5 stars, not too bad, easy to use.

Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: I have an Edge 7. Tile does NOT the way it is suppose to. I go to work, then check to see where other things might be, such as my bike or car, and it does not come up with a map showing their location. Then when I get back in near proximity, things did not automatically reconnect. I was literally holding the Tile for my backpack in my left hand and using the app on my phone in my right hand, and it would not connect. I kept on double-pressing the Tile to connect to my phone, and it would not work. I have to reboot to connect. And it has been like this since I got the Tiles 5 wks ago. I strongly recommend against this app and product. It's a good idea, but they just can't make it work.

Author: Glen Covegifts
Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Text: App works well and I really appreciate being able to locate my keys. One helpful trick is that when I travel, I place one in my checked luggage. Then watch the app when I go to baggage claim, as soon as the handlers arrive with my bag (usually behind the scenes), the app shows that it is close and I easily locate my bag. This was especially helpful one time, when the bags came down the wrong carousel! Thanks Tile!

Author: Mickey B
Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Text: For a while it did help me find my keys. It emitted a loud sound to help me find them. Now when I try to look for them it goes silent. It is practically brand new, having it only for a few months. Now it wants me to have a signal strength in order for me to find my keys just for it to emit a sound. When it does say that I should be right beside them, it still doesn't make a sound. Every now and again the alarm will ring, but on other occasions is just silence.

Author: Amber Michie
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: It does not help me find my keys. I spend more time trying to get the app to connect. I looked for my keys for days and the app wouldn't even connect to my keys. This app is a waste of time and money.

Author: A Google user
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: If my keys and phone are ever 100 ft or more away from each other they will stop communicating until I bring them back within 100 ft AND open the app to reestablish the connection. They should reconnect automatically when they get within range of each other but they don't. This means every time I get the mail or take my phone upstairs I have to open the app and let them sync up again even if they are right next to each other. If I were to run upstairs with my phone before leaving the house, drive 30 miles, go to a mall, then to a restaurant, and at the restaurant I can't find my keys, I would check the app and it would tell me my keys were last seen hours ago at home because the connection was lost when I ran upstairs before leaving and I didn't open the app to refresh it. What good is this?

Author: Alexander Gaard
Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Text: normally I would use tile if I lost my wallet in my apartment and I used the ring alarm it has to locate it, but today was the first time I really needed this app, and because of tile, my life was saved. I had dropped my wallet while walking to wholefoods and didn't realize until I got there, so I opened the app to see if it was nearby and it wasn't, which led to me tracing back my steps all the way to the street I live on until it showed my wallet was nearby, and then it wasnt......turns out that the taxi that was there on my way to wholefoods just took off as I was tetra ing my steps, so I put 2&2 together and realized the taxi driver must have it, so I followed it all the way to the stoplight (thank God I live in a city with traffic!) and the app was able to locate it nearby again, I tapped the window of the taxi and luckily the lady driving was a decent human being and was actually calling the number of one of my cards to try and contact me. If it hadn't been for tile I would've basically lost everything...my license, credit card, debit card, foreign I.d. and more.....THANK YOU TILE!!

Author: A Google user
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: Works so infrequently, it's almost useless. I wanted to show my mum how the Tile works which I had attached to my keys. I placed the keys on the table, I opened the app and the only option I got for the Tile was to notify me when found. It was 1m away! I turned Bluetooth off and back on on my phone but I still didn't get the option to ring the Tile. It would've made a good Christmas present if the app worked. With the Tile themselves, it simply wasteful that it runs only for a year or so and then you chuck it out. There's no replaceable battery. I tried the system, but it's a fail for me. Too expensive for something that works only intermittently. Oh, and there's no Windows 10/Mobile app. You'd think with all the notebooks and Surface tablets you see in the wild, it would add considerably to number of active users keeping an eye out for lost Tiles.

Author: Lance Abel
Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: Samsung Galaxy S6, running Android 7.0. The Tile App simply does not keep track of the tiles. Usually when I use the app to find tiles, they have not been 'seen' for over 24 hours. Don't waste you money on a system that does not operate correctly on Android.

Author: Frank Savino
Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Text: Handy concept in it's infant scumbag money grubbing stage.This app will possibly be worth something when it isn't rendered DISPOSABLE when the unchargable battery dies! Yes, DISPOSABLE! You are forced to throw it away and buy a new one when the internal UNCHARGABLE battery dies. (How convenient) Until they make you throw it away in order to buy a shiny new more expensive one, (with no additional features) there are plenty of notable flaws. One of which, the discovery alarm being barely audible is not exactly a treat if the friggin Item you are trying to find is LOST!!! I guess they really want you to get your money's worth saving power with their innovative disposable UNCAREGABLE, IRREPLACEABLE dead battery concept, and if it's your phone itself which is lost, a thief can simply disable the app without a code and it can never be found from another device as intended. Gone forever! Back to the drawing board for the TILE SCUM, this is Intentional garbage to steal money, and I have a sneaking suspicion as to whom is behind this trickery. DO NOT BUY THIS GARBAGE!

Author: Sam Meade
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: Tile sells/rents you a location device that you have to send back to the company after the battery runs out in a year. Then you get to buy another one! Not my cup of tea. There's a product called Trackr that is smaller, takes a replacement battery you can buy anywhere, and you own it for life. The most irritating aspect, however is that the return/replace policy is deep in the literature about the device, so as the average consumer starts search for how to recharge the device. You read more, then you discover that you get to buy a new one when the old one dies. No thanks.

Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Text: In Australia we have to purchase from retailers and Tile is Expensive at equiv USD$32 per unit per year (based on 1year battery life). If you want to buy direct fom US, then the postage on top of the Tile cost makes this an expensive expensive too. Please work with your Australian distributors to make costs more realistic. Also the retail packaging for a Tile is way over the top, and appears costly to both consumer and our planet. PS Thanks for the reply. Tile is a good product with nice service, just expensive and needs more environmentally friendly packaging.

Author: Huy Cheng
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: bought 2 Mates. Nothing more than a Bluetooth range object finder. Neither the Share Tile nor Community Search features seems to work. I share my tile with my partner. she went shopping with it. I tried the report lost feature got no response. 3 hours later still say last seen at home. I got a response when my partner got back home. Pretty useless in my book. Her phone should have picked it up and report to me. That is the purpose of sharing and community function right? Then i stop the sharing. Went to the Tile and double press it. Her phone rings?? It didnt stop ringing til I unlock her phone. Yes you read it right, only stop ringing her phone when i unlock her phone to check Why. I check her device list, the Tile is not listed on her app and somehow still got the ring tones. Double press on the tile again ring my phone this time. All the main selling points of this product all failed. And it gets worst... I try to do a transfer. Fill in email and all i got back was "oops! something went wrong." The tile app must not be close and need to be login. If u accidentally kill ur background apps then this device is literally useless. This seem rather short sighted by the developer. Should be a background service and not rely on people having this app in background.

Author: Phillip Ellis
Stars: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
Text: so my first tile was great it lasted years and had more accurate GPS, it was the first and oldest publicly sold model. when that died I got the Time Mate a smaller model it lasted a few months before it stopped ringing and never had very accurate GPS. I have just reserved my new tile sport. it feels heavier and is much louder. we will see we will see....

Author: James Kerns Jr.
Stars: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
Text: I like the tiles and like the app, for the most part. HOWEVER, when it came time to replace my original Tile with a Tile Sport, it took almost an hour to get it to pair. Sometimes it would not see the tile via Bluetooth, then sometimes it would see it, start to do the replace, then fail. I also tried adding it as a tile style, and it would tell me it didn't see a tile style, but a sport and asked me to add it. I know the Bluetooth was fine, I could set off the original Tile locator fine, and also two other devices were unable to add it as well. I hope this isn't a sign of the new tile sport's reliability with the app, I kinda wish now I stayed with the original. It's still a good product, maybe the two newest ones were rushed to market with some bugs...

Author: Ryan Smith
Stars: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
Text: Works pretty well overall. My phone is older, and the tile doesn't stay connected well if the app is closed, so I keep it open, and occasionally when I'm closing all my apps, I'll tap this app open again to bring it to the foreground. I haven't found that to be annoying since it's really helped me find my phone and wallet multiple times. Really like this product.

Author: Julian Carro
Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Text: I'm an absent minded sod and this saves me so much time. Can't find my mobile? Press the tile and find the phone. Can't find my keys? Launch the app and find them. Did throw up a worrying false result once but after a couple of minutes it got it's bearing and reassured me I hadn't left my keys at the train station. Have yet to use it to find a properly lost item, just the absentmindedly left around the house stuff.

Author: Benjamin Chapple
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: As much as I like it, the fact that you have to keep the app running is really poor planning. In the past week I've needed it to find my phone, but when the app needs to be opened on the regular to ensure a connection, it's no better than anything else on the market. I want to love it, but until you can find a way to enable a switch or push notification that keeps the app running in the background every... say, 5 minutes or so to confirm location and connection, then you might earn more than 2 stars. That, and you 'oughta go to the latest version of Bluetooth that can do over 2 connections, so you can pair it with more than just one other person. (Take a look at the Sony XBS system; 10 separate connections are possible!) Til then, I really regret spending what I did on the 4 pack for Christmas.

I value my tiles and use them quite often regardless of there minor flaws. 1 year lifespan batteries also are a neat attribute as well.

Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Text: In short it's just an awesome app. I have had ADHD my entire life and constantly lose stuff, Constantly. I was given the tile as a gift last Xmas. I lost it and only two months ago I found it and activated it and stuck it in my wallet and I lost my wallet several times only a short time though because with this app and the tile itself working as a team its easy to use and keep your stuff found. I just wish that a much smaller version would come out for my Keychain.

Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Text: First app works great with my BlackBerry Priv, Second why wouldn't you want this. I have a tile on my auto keys and it is a life saver. My niece always plays with my keys and just leave them everywhere. Now she can and I do not have to worry because the tiles Chime is loud enough to find them. Also I love that you can locate your cellphone with the tile as well. My Fianace always hid my phone from me on silence not anymore.

Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars

Author: Bea Jones
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: Do not buy this product or expect it to work if you live in a lathe & plaster home (or home with thick walls). Neither my husbands nor my cellphone will connect to any of our tiles when misplaced within the house. Talked to customer service and theu said yup - that is just the way it works. Useless.

Author: brandon kaylor
Stars: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
Text: This is a wonderful product and kudos to the inventors and tile team. I wouldn't mind paying $100 for a stainless steel version. (It would be more rugged and durable) Also the possibilities are endless with the tiles. What would it take to make a premium tile with a standalone GPS Beacon or a rechargeable battery for use on the highly valuable items.$5,000 purses or laptops. Maybe one for your car that you can plug in and never forget where you park. Or even a tile that would be permanent and unremovable so if your item gets stolen then you will always be able to find it. (Similar to LoJack) I am grateful for the entire tile company. I use my tiles on many items and put some of them to great use! I probably lose my keys three times a week and when I'm late for work the tile keeps me on time by taking minimal time to find my car keys or wallet. I have so many ideas that I want to share that I should probably apply for a job!

Author: Danielle R
Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Text: This is the BEST device ever!!! The first one I recieved was defective and the Tile company worked to get me a new one. I never fear losing my keys after receiving the replacement. My fiancee just activated his and we located his keys just now. I cannot wait to order more!!!

Text: This app is garbage. I will open it and it'll say that my keys or wallet are nearby and that it's connecting, but it will just stay like that indefinitely, almost never fully connecting to the point where I can press 'Find.' I end up finally finding my keys or wallet on my own, and it turns out it was literally a foot or two away from my phone, but the app still couldn't connect them together. This is a great concept but it almost never is functional for me.

Author: DFW DFW
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: Great idea and they work fairly well. However, after about a year, every time you open the app it tells you you need to buy entirely new tiles and replace them. First off, if they are only meant to last a year, why does each tile visit so much? Secondly, why would you design the tiles to only last a key. (My electric key for my car lasted 5 years before it needed a new battery.) Third, why haven't the tiles been designed so that we can replace the dead battery ourselves; this design clearly represents pure greed on the company's part. Finally, the app isn't actually measuring the battery strength of the actual tiles; mine have worked for a few months beyond when Tile started harassing me through the app to replace all my tiles at full cost. This is bad design, pure greed, and bait-and-switch.

Author: Mick Carson
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: All talk and no action, and the demonstration video proves that. Just like the same scam on TrackerR, tile is no different. They're not going to tell you the truth on Bluetooth range, whether it is affected by buildings and walls or car bodies. All talk and no actions. The only way you can track things is by using a GPS locator that uses a SIM card with 1Gb of data. These may be a little costly but you can be sure on tour mother's grave you will find what you've lost. And then you will surprised and say money well spent! But not on this rubbish if it used Bluetooth. We already know Bluetooth is a low range signal so there is no way you will find your lost belongings unless you are just metres from a Tile tracker, or unless millions of phones have the App installed for pinging one another. If that's the case it may only be good in cities but if you lost the item, pet, car, in the bush, while camping, etc., ?? Only a GPS locator can find what you lost anywhere on Earth. Don't waste your money on puny little kid's toys.

Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: It's useful but not in a pinch, not by a long shot. Let's say you can't find your keys so you open the app. The app will just randomly cycle trying to connect to everything listed, you can't just open your keys and tell it to find that. Do this leaves you frustratingly waiting around for it to maybe get to your keys. I say maybe because sometimes it won't even bother. It'll just say found 1 minute ago...great... where. My review changes back to a 5 when they let us cancel connections and choose specific devices. It's not worth the hundred or so yearly cost if it can't do something so basic.

Author: jpsilly42
Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Text: Best device ever! I'm old enough to remember the "Echo Keychain" - whistle for your keys... this is even better. I've got a Galaxy S7 Edge & have no problems whatsoever. I left my vape at my friend's house with its Tile attached, and when I sent out the signal from my phone it actually rang at her house and she called me to tell me I left it there (She has Tiles too). I haven't had them very long, so I'd have to update later on battery life. So far so good, two thumbs up, 10 out of 10, and five stars!

Author: Angela Richie
Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Text: It's only about 40% successful at finding my phone, and customer support didn't bother reading my email when I complained about it; they just offered me tips to fix an issue I don't have and didn't complain about. Now, I'm being reminded that it's time to re-tile when I've got 5 months left on the battery, and my only option to get rid of the notification is to be reminded again in either 1 or 15 days. I don't feel very appreciated at all; I feel more like a wallet than a customer.

Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars

I want this because if you are outdoor and you forgot to pick up your things and leave from that place, your mobile should start ringing at that moment rather then you reach home and search for your tile. This feature will ensure that all your things are near you wherever you are.As soon as I get this feature I will give 5 stars instead of 4 stars I have given now.

Replacement cost is too high, so I will be deleting the app and trashing the tiles.

Especially considering they only track their last known location (not true GPS), and after barely a year, all four tiles i bought are dead. $60 a year for a simple function? You can find cheaper alternatives

Author: A Google user
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: Utter crap. Fortunately did not invest a dime in this garbage as I got a couple of tiles at a tradeshow for free. First, the pairing is glitchy as only the first tile wanted to pair. Supposedly only way to remedy it is to turn phone off for 2 minutes. Doesn't do a thing. On a hunch I took one of the tiles apart against the advice of the support site ("void warranty, risk of electric shock"), bah! fat chance of that with the standard CR2032 coin cell powering it! You might as well have tried to convince us you hid an alligator inside too! The powercell was micro spot welded to a metal strip connected to the circuit board. I wanted to see what the tile would do when it lost power. Ripped said metal strip off the battery with a pair of pliers, then reconnected the cell.. And wouldn't you know it, the tile paired like a charm (no user serviceable parts inside, huh?) Only downside; the casing was done for, as its ridiculously hard to open (no match for a thin hacksaw blade and a little patience). I managed to find a new key chain case for it, but only because I stubbornly refused to let it go to waste. All in all it feels like these things are made to buy and throw away, which grinds my lifehacker gears. Make a version with replaceable battery, and allow me to factory reset my tiles without having to McGyver them, then I'll try them again. Thanks for playing.

Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars

Unlike the Keylink which I could barely hear, I've found the Tile alarm to be loud enough and I'm hard of hearing.  Going the other way around to locate the connected devices from the Tile works as well.  There are some current drawbacks such as non-replaceable battery but I'm quite satisfied for now.

Saved me $250 for a new volkswagen key! Love tile worth every penny AND sending it away for a new battery. Thanks!

Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars

I like the idea of changing the battery which is the option you get with the Track R devices. That is why I bought 12 units of the Track R devices as Christmas presents for members of my family instead of the Tile.

Text: I'm okay with the prospect of replacing the device yearly in place of the convenience and usefulness it gives me. But the application is just a battery hog taking hours off my phone everyday, and that I can't live with. After several months of use I have been charging my phone twice or three times a day. The S7 edge has always given me stellar battery life but at 1.0% of battery every hour, I can't continue using this app. Chipolo is a tenth or less the usage and performance and features are nearly the same.

Author: Jack Wood
Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Text: My Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge (running Android OS 6.0.1) is still having the same connection problems even after today's update (03/14/17). The app has problems connecting to the Tiles paired with my phone. I must still open the app and let my phone and Tiles connect; but as soon as I set the app to run in the background, my phone and Tiles lose connection. These tiles have already been replaced; part of a 4-pack of the original 1st-Gen Tiles (keyring hole in top left corner, & the word 'tile' in grey letters across the bottom with the letter 'e' in the bottom right corner being the communication button.) I purchased the 4-pack shortly before the 2nd-Generation Tiles were released, but these replacements are still the original 1st-generation Tiles. A nextdoor neighbor has a few Tiles (a Slim Wallet Tile & a second-generation keyring Tile - with the the 'tile' button in the center) and he has no problem with them always staying connected to his phone which is also a Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge, but running the latest Android OS 7.0. Please give me a solution to fix this problem once and for all.

The support team was not very helpful indicating that my Tile was connected. At that particular moment it was, but they didn't address the issue of the app being unable to connect to the Tile for several hours throughout the day. I'm very disappointed and would not recommend this app or product.

Author: Manuel Ángel Abeledo García
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: Kind of worked for a while. When I upgraded my phone to a Pixel XL, I found out that the bluetooth connection to my car was quite unstable, and I finally tracked it down to this app, which restarts the bluetooth subsystem every once in a while, no kidding. This is the best they could come up with, to restart the whole bluetooth thing when Tiles can't be found. Tiles themselves look good and all that, but this stupid hack, plus the fact that you can't recharge the Tile battery (yes, if you run out of power, you need to buy new ones), is ridiculous. Fun fact, when I contacted the Tile support, they told me to either upgrade the app or turn the wifi on. Seriously.

Author: Carla D Viltz
Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Text: One day, I was not steady on my feet & dropped my cell phone. I was busy for 4hrs before I noticed my phone was gone. I was in such a panick, I looked in all usual places at home; retraced my steps, in my mind, of the buildings I was in; then thought about my steps between the places I went. Best part, I remembered I had the tile on my keys & it worked in reverse & could find my phone. So I pressed the Tile button in my house; no luck. Then I retraced my steps & found my phone in some low bushes a block & a half away from my home. My phone is black & faced down. Could be why no one else found it. Now it is time to upgrade my Tile!🤗

Author: Simon Greer
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: I got sent on a wild goose chase trying to find my phone in a field as the app reported it there after I walked my dog. The app and the tile button both failed to work despite being within one metre of the phone. All services were working correctly and another tracker managed to correctly report my phone's location. Really bad.

Author: Christopher Kelly
Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Text: ...enough for me to deal with it spamming notifications every 20 minutes. If I made an app/device where Bluetooth was so important I would at least make sure my app wasn't complete garbage and could properly heartbeat a connection without whining to the user to constantly to restart Bluetooth. And no, your setting isn't an option because then your app finds it necessary to reboot and disconnect my headphones whenever I connect them.

Author: Amir Shadaab Mohammed
Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Text: I found my keys that I lost on the train. The keys rolled down under the seat and there was no way anyone could find it and drop it off at lost and found. I got a message when I took the train again telling me that my tile was nearby. I walked around, made it ring and finally found my keys. In short, Tile is awesome.

Author: Brian Duval
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: The app severely interferes with my Bluetooth connection to my headphones and to the car, causing lots of jittering. Otherwise, good for finding my lost things. I just can't leave it running all the time which neuters the ability to find the phone.

Author: James Stewart
Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Text: I'm burnt and lose everything... I bought a tile for my keys and it has saved me enough time and aggravation to pay for itself ten times. Can't wait til I can afford a few more tiles for my wallet, Ect...

Author: Eric Jeffcoat
Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Text: Persistent "tile wants to restart your bluetooth" notifications were too tedious to keep dismissing. I uninstalled the app and will not re-tile until there is an option to disable the notifications. It's a great product however the lack of an option to disable these notifications overshadows any usefulness when most of my time is spent checking and dismissing these notifications

Author: Adam Monsen
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: The Tile app has a major bug: it messes up Bluetooth on my Nexus 5 (hammerhead - stock Android 6.0.1). After a day or so of operation I am unable to make Bluetooth phone calls. I contacted support. If this gets resolved I'll probably update this to 5 stars because everything else about the app seems peachy.

Author: Mark Meikle
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: Now telling me I need to replace my tiles after only a year or two. Would have been nice to know this up front. Sheesh. Thanks tile! Sarcastically... Not a good value.

Author: Rob Marshall
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: Concept is good, but this program basically breaks Bluetooth, I listen to podcasts on the way to work using Bluetooth and have done for years. If I am using tile, the audio is broken and distorted. If I turn off Bluetooth and turn it back on the audio is fine for a while, them after a while it breaks again, there is an option in the app labelled something like allow me to fix Bluetooth, ironic as it is the app that breaks it, and it only fixes it for the app stopping the unending error messages, please resolve this, I have a pixel with nougat, uninstalled till this is resolved

Author: Angelina Henegar
Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars

VERY PLEASED

Author: Michael Ruth
Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Text: So far works as it should. Nice interface. Great idea, but the app is way to memory hungry. It's been running for several hours in the background, and I knew it would, but it's using 310-350 MB of RAM. That's just crazy. That's more than 3x the next biggest RAM using app. I'm not sure I'm going to continue letting it run.

Author: Stuart Nottage
Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Text: Its a great tool for finding lost keys

Author: Joules Duncan
Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Text: When you buy one of these keep in mind that at least once a year you have to buy a new one. I just went to another company after having a Tile for 2 years. The new one I have has replaceable batteries. I just saved myself $20 or more a year. Also it is a little creepy that random people can send me a message that they've found my keys when I haven't lost them just because they have a Tile too and see me on the map. That's weird.

Author: James Jennings
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: I never write app reviews but I felt obliged to write this one. When I first bought my tile mate it connected to my phone correctly but a couple of days later it required a phone restart each time to connect. A week later it was impossible to connect at all. Of course I contacted support who said perhaps my phone is not Bluetooth 4.0 enabled (which it is). I tried to connect on 2 other Android devices (running Lollipop) without success. Perhaps I was unlucky with my device compatibility but the support team has not resolved my issues and my advice to others would be to avoid buying Tile if you are using Android.

Author: Lee Storgaard
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: Really like the functionality of the app but it constantly complains that it's having problems with Bluetooth and wants to restart the service. Has happened on two different phones now and interrupts things like streaming to Bluetooth speakers. I've submitted error reports but no response from Tile. Even with updates still an issue.

Author: Vinsanity 52
Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Text: This is the best thing ever. I always loose my wallet keys and phone, and this app/devices makes sure I always know where they are. Knowing where they were last is great, and if you loose your phone, you can double tap the button on the tiles, or if it's not in Bluetooth range you can search for it on their website.

Author: Steve H
Stars: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Text: Buggy app. Samsung S7 Edge will *TURN OFF* Bluetooth altogether, silently, if you leave this Tile app running. Something about Tile either crashes the Bluetooth stack or turns it off -- impossible to tell why. Unfortunately, if you do NOT leave it running, the Tile is pretty useless. It will never ring the phone. Finding the tile sometimes work, but you have to run the app and leave it running for a while before it can find the Tiles. To that end, it sort-of works.

Author: J. Andres Hannah-Suarez
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: To call the system crap would malign crap. I lost my keys twice with the Tile on. The first time was in my 1 bedroom apartment. While on search mode, I ran into my keys before they ever rang. At points in my search I was within 2 metres and it didn't ring. The second time was outside my apartment. I live in downtown Toronto. To this day, they've never been located. I'm sorry if your system doesn't work in the densest urban environment in Canada, it is officially worthless. Don't buy into this terrible system!

Don't get me wrong, it does work maybe once every five or six times I need it to, but it is horribly inconsistent and practically useless as it is. It's been exhibiting this behaviour more and more since month two. Do not buy.
